intro: Trifolium ottonis, commonly known as Otto's clover, is a species of flowering plant in the legume family, Fabaceae. It is characterized by its trifoliate leaves, which consist of three oval-shaped leaflets arranged symmetrically. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Native to the mountainous regions of Europe, it thrives in well-drained soils and full sun. Due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and restoration projects.
